concept.title: Purpose of the Commutator
concept.shortdesc: The commutator, also known as a timer, controls spark plug firing timing by managing the electrical circuit in the primary system through a rotating mechanism.

section.title: Functional Overview
section.p: The commutator serves two primary functions:

ul.li: Determines the precise moment when spark plugs must fire
Controls the make and break action in the primary circuit

section.title: Operating Mechanism
section.p: The electrical current flows through the following path:

ol.li: Current flows from the grounded wire in the magneto through metal parts
Current reaches the metal roller in the commutator
As the roller revolves, it touches four commutator contact points
Each contact point connects to a coil unit via attached wires
This creates a momentary electrical circuit through the primary wire system

section.title: Maintenance Requirement
section.p: For optimal performance, the commutator requires regular maintenance:

ul.li: Maintain proper lubrication at all times
